definitions.definition: One who violates (a rule, a boundary, another person's body, etc.); offender

In the publishing and packaging industries, a visual element that intentionally "violates" the underlying design, such as a starburst, color bar or "splat" on a product package or magazine cover intended to attract special attention.
To eject or erupt.
To fire (a bullet, arrow etc.).
To remove from membership.
definitions.example: He was expelled from school multiple times.

definitions.definition: To deport.
To change to a lower gear in a vehicle
The application of careful and attentive effort.
Carefully attentive to details; diligent in performing a process or procedure.
To tax the patience of, irk, frustrate, vex, provoke, annoy; to make angry.
Having one's patience greatly taxed; greatly annoyed; made furious.
Made worse or more intense.
A roadside camera, triggered by a speeding vehicle, that takes a photograph of the offending vehicle and records its speed.
A marital relationship in which each partner agrees that the other partner may have sexual relations with other people as he or she sees fit.

Any member of a race of beings from (especially Scandinavian and other Germanic) folklore, usually depicted as having some sort of supernatural powers and being skilled in crafting and metalworking, often as short with long beards, and sometimes as clashing with elves.
A person of short stature, often one whose limbs are disproportionately small in relation to the body as compared with normal adults, usually as the result of a genetic condition.
An animal, plant or other thing much smaller than the usual of its sort.
definitions.example: dwarf honeysuckle

definitions.definition: A star of relatively small size.
To render (much) smaller, turn into a dwarf (version).
To make appear (much) smaller, puny, tiny.
definitions.example: The newly-built skyscraper dwarfs all older buildings in the downtown skyline.

definitions.definition: To make appear insignificant.
definitions.example: Bach dwarfs all other composers.

definitions.definition: To become (much) smaller.
To hinder from growing to the natural size; to make or keep small; to stunt.
Miniature.
definitions.example: It is possible to grow the plants as dwarf as one desires.

definitions.definition: To construct again; to restore.
To attempt to understand an event by recreating or talking through the circumstances.
A smooth, chewy, sticky confection made by heating sugar and other ingredients until the sugars polymerize and become sticky.
A (sometimes hardened) piece of this confection.
A yellow-brown color, like that of caramel.
To caramelize.
Of a yellow-brown color.
To cause strain or anxiety to someone.
To retain someone’s property against the payment of a debt; to distrain.
To treat a new object to give it an appearance of age.
definitions.example: She distressed the new media cabinet so that it fit with the other furniture in the room.

definitions.definition: Causing distress; upsetting; distressful.
definitions.example: The details of the ordeal can be distressing to some readers.

definitions.definition: To produce no effect; to fail in the intended effect.
definitions.example: The politician's speech fell flat.

definitions.definition: (strict sense) A word that both sounds and is spelled the same as another word.
A word that sounds or is spelled the same as another word, technically called a homophone (same sound) or a homograph (same spelling).
A name for a taxon that is identical in spelling to another name that belongs to a different taxon.
The figure of the moon as it appears in its first or last quarter, with concave and convex edges terminating in points.
Something shaped like a crescent, especially:
A representation of the symbol used by Islamic caliphates
A crescent spanner.
Any of three orders of knighthood conferred upon foreigners to whom Turkey might be indebted for valuable services.
The emblem of the waxing Moon with horns directed upward, when used in a coat of arms; often used as a mark of cadency to distinguish a second son and his descendants.
A crescentspot butterfly.
To form into a crescent, or something resembling a crescent.
To adorn with crescents.
Marked by an increase; waxing, like the Moon.
Shaped like a crescent.
To waste away; to fade, to wither
To daunt or frighten (someone)
To lose heart or courage; to be daunted or fearful.
Of courage, faith, etc.: to slacken, to give way.
Any of various small game birds of the genera Coturnix, Anurophasis or Perdicula in the Old World family Phasianidae or of the New World family Odontophoridae.
The meat from this bird eaten as food.
A prostitute, so called because the quail was thought to be a very amorous bird.
To curdle or coagulate, as milk does.
To wear clothes typically associated with the opposite sex.
To display on the surface of a dendritic cell antigens produced by a different cell.
The wearing of clothing which society considers appropriate for the opposite sex rather than the wearer's sex.
Display by antigen-presenting cells of antigens obtained from the surface of infected cells.
An incarnate being or form.
A living being embodying a deity or spirit.
An assumption of human form or nature.
A person or thing regarded as embodying or exhibiting some quality, idea, or the like.
definitions.example: The leading dancer is the incarnation of grace.

definitions.definition: The act of incarnating.
The state of being incarnated.
A rosy or red colour; flesh colour; carnation.
The process of healing wounds and filling the part with new flesh; granulation.
The policy of forcefully extending a nation's authority by territorial gain or by the establishment of economic and political dominance over other nations.
One's parent's spouse who is not one's biological parent
Not defensible; not capable of being defended
Incapable of being justified or excused
Incapable of being explained
To transfer (the title) of an object from one person or group of persons to another.
The drawing of deeds etc. concerning transfer of property, and the legal execution of such transfers.
A batted ball that lands in foul territory.
definitions.example: It's a foul ball, up four rows of seats.

definitions.definition: A person who buys and sells shares (stock) on a stock exchange on behalf of clients. May also provide investment advice and/or company information, depending on the level of service offered (or chosen by the client).
A concrete margin along the edge of a road; a kerb (UK, Australia, New Zealand)
A raised margin along the edge of something, such as a well or the eye of a dome, as a strengthening.
Something that checks or restrains; a restraint.

A riding or driving bit for a horse that has rein action which amplifies the pressure in the mouth by leverage advantage placing pressure on the poll via the crown piece of the bridle and chin groove via a curb chain.
A sidewalk, covered or partially enclosed, bordering the airport terminal road system with adjacent paved areas to permit vehicles to off-load or load passengers.
A swelling on the back part of the hind leg of a horse, just behind the lowest part of the hock joint, generally causing lameness.
To check, restrain or control.
definitions.example: "Curb your dog."

definitions.definition: To rein in.
To furnish with a curb, as a well; to restrain by a curb, as a bank of earth.
To force to "bite the curb" (hit the pavement curb); see curb stomp.
To damage vehicle wheels or tires by running into or over a pavement curb.
To bend or curve.
To crouch; to cringe.
Two feature-length motion pictures being shown back-to-back in a movie theatre, available to view for the price of a single ticket.
To exhibit the best attributes of something.
definitions.example: Grocery stores show off their produce by placing the most attractive specimens in front.

definitions.definition: To attract attention to for the purpose of bragging or personal exhibitionism; to demonstrate a skill, talent or property for the purpose of bragging or personal exhibitionism.
definitions.example: She loves to show off her driving prowess.

definitions.definition: One who shows off.
definitions.example: Quit being such a show-off, before someone gets hurt.

definitions.definition: A graphic display of reporting relationships in an organization, sometimes displaying position titles and position holders.
To personally verify that (someone or something) is safe, copacetic, appropriate or satisfactory.
definitions.example: I sent Tom to check on the northside's branch's progress.

definitions.definition: To verify a specific fact; to quickly examine a situation, especially to look for updates or new information on a topic that has previously been discussed.
definitions.example: Have the price-tags been updated? I'll check on that right away, sir.

definitions.definition: To make melancholy; to sadden or grieve (someone).
(heading) Emotionally negative.
Sated, having had one's fill; satisfied, weary.
Steadfast, valiant.
Dignified, serious, grave.
Naughty; troublesome; wicked.
Unfashionable; socially inadequate or undesirable.
definitions.example: I can't believe you use drugs; you're so sad!

definitions.definition: Soggy (to refer to pastries).
Heavy; weighty; ponderous; close; hard.
definitions.example: sad bread

definitions.definition: The letter ص in the Arabic script.
To remove obstructions, impediments or other unwanted items from.
definitions.example: If you clear the table, I'll wash up.

definitions.definition: To remove (items or material) so as to leave something unobstructed or open.
definitions.example: Please clear all this stuff off the table.

definitions.definition: To become free from obstruction or obscurement; to become transparent.
definitions.example: After a heavy rain, the sky cleared nicely for the evening.

definitions.definition: To eliminate ambiguity or doubt from (a matter); to clarify or resolve; to clear up.
definitions.example: We need to clear this issue once and for all.

definitions.definition: To remove from suspicion, especially of having committed a crime.
definitions.example: The court cleared the man of murder.

definitions.definition: To pass without interference; to miss.
definitions.example: The door just barely clears the table as it closes.

definitions.definition: (activities such as jumping or throwing) To exceed a stated mark.
definitions.example: She was the first female high jumper to clear two metres.

definitions.definition: To finish or complete (a stage, challenge, or game).
definitions.example: I cleared the first level in 36 seconds.

definitions.definition: Of a check or financial transaction, to go through as payment; to be processed so that the money is transferred.
definitions.example: The check might not clear for a couple of days.

definitions.definition: To earn a profit of; to net.
definitions.example: He's been clearing seven thousand a week.

definitions.definition: To approve or authorise for a particular purpose or action; to give clearance to.
definitions.example: Air traffic control cleared the plane to land.

definitions.definition: To obtain approval or authorisation in respect of.
definitions.example: I've cleared the press release with the marketing department, so go ahead and publish it.

definitions.definition: To obtain a clearance.
definitions.example: The steamer cleared for Liverpool today.

definitions.definition: To obtain permission to use (a sample of copyrighted audio) in another track.
To disengage oneself from incumbrances, distress, or entanglements; to become free.
To hit, kick, head, punch etc. (a ball, puck) away in order to defend one's goal.
definitions.example: A low cross came in, and Smith cleared.

definitions.definition: To reset or unset; to return to an empty state or to zero.
definitions.example: to clear an array;  to clear a single bit (binary digit) in a value

definitions.definition: To style (an element within a document) so that it is not permitted to float at a given position.
The act or process of making or becoming clear.
An area of land within a wood or forest devoid of trees.
An open space in the fog etc.
A process of exchanging transaction information and authorisation through a central institution or system to complete and settle those transactions.
A sequence of events used to disconnect a call, and return to the ready state.
The period in which remaining university places are allocated to remaining students.
The act of removing the ball from one's own goal area by kicking it.
A constitutional system of governance.
Adherence to constitutional principles.
Philosophical belief in government under a written constitution.
A pop-up; a fly ball to the infield or the shallow outfield.
On which no rent is payable.
Without paying rent.
A large flat surface, finished with black slate or a similar material, that can be written upon with chalk and subsequently erased; a chalkboard.
To use a blackboard to assist in an informal discussion.
An open-top or soft-top motor car suitable for touring.
A touring bicycle.
A senior nurse leading teams of community nurses which provide health care to patients within their own homes.
A sound articulated at the soft palate
Articulated at the velum or soft palate.
Referring to a veil or velum.
An industrial complex where electricity is produced.

Any of various small mammals, of the family Mephitidae, native to North and Central America, having a glossy black with a white coat and two musk glands at the base of the tail for emitting a noxious smell as a defensive measure.
A despicable person.
A walkover victory in sports or board games, as when the opposing side is unable to score. Compare shutout.
A win by 30 or more points.
To defeat so badly as to prevent any opposing points.
definitions.example: I skunked him at cards.

definitions.definition: To win by 30 or more points.
(of beer) To go bad, to spoil.
A member of a hybrid skinhead and punk subculture.
Any of the strains of hybrids of Cannabis sativa and Cannabis indica that may have THC levels exceeding those of typical hashish.
Any of several American plants that have an offensive odour, but especially Croton texensis and Polemonium viscosum
Strong-smelling cannabis
Food, especially meat and potatoes, chopped and mixed together.
A confused mess.
The # symbol (octothorpe, pound).
The result generated by a hash function.
A new mixture of old material; a second preparation or exhibition; a rehashing.
A hash run.
A stupid fellow.
To chop into small pieces, to make into a hash.
To make a quick, rough version
definitions.example: We need to quickly hash up some plans.

definitions.definition: To transform according to a hash function.
Hashish, a drug derived from the cannabis plant.
A rapid-response unit of a police force.
An explosive device sent through the post, triggered to explode when the letter or packet is opened.
A virus contained within an email or similar file.
A pitch that is intentionally thrown high and outside of the strike zone in order to prevent a stolen base
A region of the stratosphere over Antarctica (and a smaller one over the Arctic) that is depleted of ozone in the local spring.
To recover, especially from an illness; to get better from an illness.
To co-opt subversive ideas for mainstream use
A heavy, long handled maul or hammer used to drive stakes, wedges, etc.
To hit with a sledgehammer.
A low sled drawn by animals, typically on snow, ice or grass.
definitions.example: The sledge ran far better upon the ice; I cannot say the same for the dogs.

definitions.definition: Any type of sled or sleigh.
A card game resembling all fours and seven-up; old sledge.
To drag or draw a sledge.
To ride, travel with or transport in a sledge.
To verbally insult or abuse an opponent in order to distract them (considered unsportsmanlike).
The fleshy appendage that hangs from the back of the palate, that closes the nasopharynx during swallowing.
The slight elevation in the mucous membrane immediately behind the internal urethral orifice of the urinary bladder, caused by the middle lobe of the prostate.
An object so suspended inside a bell that it may hit the bell and cause it to ring; a clapper.
Near this place; nearby.
By this means, action or process.
definitions.example: I hereby declare you husband and wife.

definitions.definition: An East Asian cultivar or subspecies of radish (Raphanus raphanistrum subsp. sativus, syn. Raphanus sativus) bearing a large, white, carrot-shaped taproot consumed throughout East and South Asia but grown in North America primarily as a fallow crop for its fast-growing leaves (used as animal fodder) and as a soil ripper.
Closely-related cultivars such as the enormous turnip-shaped Sakurajima or green-and-red watermelon radish.
The act of taking possession, as by force or right of law.
definitions.example: The search warrant permitted the seizure of evidence.

definitions.definition: A sudden attack or convulsion, (e.g. an epileptic seizure).
definitions.example: He fell to the floor and convulsed when the epileptic seizure occurred.

definitions.definition: A sudden onset of pain or emotion.
definitions.example: He felt the sudden seizure of pain as the heart attack began.

definitions.definition: That which is seized, or taken possession of; a thing laid hold of, or possessed.
Retention within one's grasp or power; possession; ownership.
Grandfather
Showing the characteristics considered typical of a man; macho or manly
(by extension) Courageous; noble; high-minded.
A person who works undercover.
To provide too little coverage.
Performed or happening in secret.
Employed or engaged in spying or secret investigation.
Any of various plants of the family Cucurbitaceae grown for food, generally not including the cucumber.
The fruit of such plants.
A light pinkish orange colour, like that of some melon flesh.
(usually in the plural) Breasts.
The head.
A member of the Green Party, or similar environmental group.
A mass of adipose tissue found in the forehead of all toothed whales, used to focus and modulate vocalizations.
Of a light pinkish orange colour, like that of melon flesh.
The result of heptazine being polymerized with the tri-s-triazine units linked through an amine (NH) link.

A unit of length corresponding approximately to one minute of arc of latitude along any meridian. By international agreement it is exactly 1,852 metres (approximately 6,076 feet or 1.151 statute mile).
A large theatre, cinema, or stadium.
definitions.example: the London Coliseum

definitions.definition: A large, often circular building, for indoor sporting events, exhibitions, concerts, etc.; arena.
Unable to see and hear.
A unit of angle equal to 0.9 degrees, so that there are 100 gradians in a right angle.
A person who is recognized by a university as having completed the requirements of a degree studied at the institution.
definitions.example: If the government wants graduates to stay in the country they should offer more incentives.

definitions.definition: A person who is recognized by a high school as having completed the requirements of a course of study at the school.
A person who is recognized as having completed any level of education.
A graduated (marked) cup or other container, thus fit for measuring.
The action or process of graduating and receiving a diploma for completing a course of study (such as from an educational institution).
A commencement ceremony.
A marking (e.g., on a container) indicating a measurement, usually one of many such markings that are each separated by a constant interval.
The exposure of a liquid in large surfaces to the air, so as to hasten its evaporation.
A type of Soviet artillery multiple rocket launcher, or a rocket fired by this.
A brief interval of forgetfulness or inattention.
A member of the gendarmerie, a military body charged with police duties.
Policeman.
A rock pinnacle on a mountain ridge.
A pitch that comes very close to the batter, forcing them to move back from the plate.
An action intended to threaten or frighten someone.
A species of antelope endemic to Africa, Kobus ellipsiprymnus.
Any member of Caninae, the only living subfamily of Canidae.
Any of certain extant canids regarded as similar to the dog or wolf (including coyotes, jackals, etc.) but distinguished from the vulpines, which are regarded as fox-like.
In heterodont mammals, the pointy tooth between the incisors and the premolars; a cuspid.
A king and a nine as a starting hand in Texas hold 'em due to phonetic similarity.
Of, or pertaining to, a dog or dogs.
Dog-like.
Of or pertaining to mammalian teeth which are cuspids or fangs.
Of an appetite: depraved or inordinate; used to describe eating disorders.
In writing or editing, to write (something: either an entire word or text, or just the initial letter(s) thereof) in capital letters, in upper case.
definitions.example: In German, all nouns are capitalized.

definitions.definition: To contribute or acquire capital (money or other resources) for.
definitions.example: Some states require proof that a new venture is properly capitalized before the state will issue a certificate of incorporation.

definitions.definition: To convert into capital, i.e., to get cash or similar immediately fungible resources for some less fungible property or source of future income.
definitions.example: If we obtain a loan using the business as collateral, the effect will be to capitalize our next ten years of income, giving us cash today that we can use to buy out our competitor.

definitions.definition: To treat as capital, not as an expense.
To profit or to obtain an advantage.
definitions.example: The home team took several shots on goal but was unable to capitalize until late in the game.

definitions.definition: (followed by on) To seize, as an opportunity; to obtain a benefit; to invest on something profitable.
definitions.example: The home team appeared to have the advantage throughout the game, and finally capitalized on their opponents' weakness with just two minutes remaining, scoring several points in quick succession.

definitions.definition: A team; a group of people who work together professionally.
A small group of birds or animals.
An entity having legal personality, and thus able to own property and to sue and be sued in its own name; a corporation.
Any business, whether incorporated or not, that manufactures or sells products (also known as goods), or provides services as a commercial venture.
Social visitors or companions.
definitions.example: Keep the house clean; I have company coming.

definitions.definition: Companionship.
definitions.example: I treasure your company.

definitions.definition: They (singular). Gender-neutral subject pronoun, coordinate with gendered pronouns he and she.
Them (singular). Gender-neutral object pronoun, coordinate with gendered pronouns him and her.
The jewfish.
To bargain, to attempt to gain an unfair price in a business deal; to defraud.
A missile that is initially guided, but then follows a ballistic (freely falling) trajectory.
Ill-disposed attitude; grudge; dislike.
definitions.example: The losing side bore no ill will toward the winners.

definitions.definition: A brief high-pitched sound, as from some electronic device.
Something named by an explicit noun in the original, unedited version of the containing sentence.
definitions.example: What the bleep are you doing?

definitions.definition: A broad genre of electronic music with goth and industrial influences, as opposed to traditional gothic rock.
To emit one or more bleeps.
definitions.example: The robot bleeped to acknowledge its new instructions.

definitions.definition: To edit out inappropriate spoken language in a broadcast by replacing offending words with bleeps.
Any of various medium-large black seabirds of the family Phalacrocoracidae, especially the great cormorant, Phalacrocorax carbo.
A voracious eater.
Ravenous, greedy.
Any of the large, hairy New World spiders comprising the family Theraphosidae.
(by extension) A member of certain other groups of spiders, generally characterized by large size, hairiness, or membership of infraorder Mygalomorphae to which Theraphosidae family also belongs.
A species of wolf spider, Lycosa tarantula, native to southern Europe, the mildly poisonous bite of which was once thought to cause an extreme urge to dance (tarantism).
A belvedere, either a type of summer-house or a roofed, detached porch-like structure, usually in a yard, park or lawn.
To connect (an electrical conductor or device) to a ground.
To punish, especially a child or teenager, by forcing him/her to stay at home and/or give up certain privileges.
definitions.example: Eric, you are grounded until further notice for lying to us about where you were last night!

definitions.definition: To forbid (an aircraft or pilot) to fly.
definitions.example: Because of the bad weather, all flights were grounded.

definitions.definition: To give a basic education in a particular subject; to instruct in elements or first principles.
definitions.example: Jim was grounded in maths.

definitions.definition: To hit a ground ball. Compare fly (verb(regular)) and line (verb).
To place something on the ground.
To run aground; to strike the bottom and remain fixed.
definitions.example: The ship grounded on the bar.

definitions.definition: To found; to fix or set, as on a foundation, reason, or principle; to furnish a ground for; to fix firmly.
To cover with a ground, as a copper plate for etching, or as paper or other materials with a uniform tint as a preparation for ornament.
To improve or focus the mental or emotional state of.
definitions.example: I ground myself with meditation.

definitions.definition: Fundamental knowledge or background in a field or discipline.
The return to a fully conscious state after a psychedelic experience.
The collision of a ship with ground beneath the surface of the water.
The prevention of aircraft takeoff because of government action.

The interconnecting metal chassis/frame of a device, appliance, machine, or metal raceway via a designated conductor to earth at the service panel. It may be bare or covered, and does not carry current in normal operation.
The absorption of energy through visualized "roots" descending from oneself into the ground, using chi.
The act by which a child is grounded (forbidden from going out, using electronics, etc.).
The background of embroidery, etc.
That causes one to cringe with embarrassment; embarrassing.
A person who oversees the day-to-day operation of a computer system
A nocturnal omnivore native to North America, typically with a mixture of gray, brown, and black fur, a mask-like marking around the eyes and a striped tail; Procyon lotor.
Any mammal of the genus Procyon.
Any mammal of the subfamily Procyoninae, a procyonine.
Any mammal of the family Procyonidae, a procyonid.
Any of the military expeditions undertaken by the Christians of Europe in the 11th to 13th centuries to reconquer the Levant from the Muslims.
definitions.example: During the crusades, many Muslims and Christians and Jews were slaughtered.

definitions.definition: Any war instigated and blessed by the Church for alleged religious ends. Especially, papal sanctioned military campaigns against infidels or heretics.
A grand concerted effort toward some purportedly worthy cause.
definitions.example: a crusade against drug abuse

definitions.definition: A mass gathering in a political campaign or during a religious revival effort.
A Portuguese coin; a crusado.
To go on a military crusade.
To make a grand concerted effort toward some purportedly worthy cause.
definitions.example: He crusaded against similar injustices for the rest of his life.

definitions.definition: Full of energy; exuberant; noisy.
Characterized by violence and agitation; wild; stormy.
Having or resembling animal exuberance.
(of people) Very high-spirited; extremely energetic and enthusiastic.
definitions.example: exuberant feeling

definitions.definition: (of things that grow) Abundant, luxuriant.
definitions.example: exuberant foliage

definitions.definition: Surreal number
Resembling a dream: fantastic and incongruous
